com.att.research.xacml.std.json

Class JSONRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacml.std.json.JSONRequest

  • public class JSONRequest
extends java.lang.Object
    JSONRequest is used to convert JSON into Request objects. Instances are only generated by loading a file, string, or InputStream representing the Request.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.3 $
    Author:
    glenngriffin

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void convert(Request request, java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
      Convert the Request object into a string suitable for output.
      static void convert(Request request, java.io.OutputStream outputStream, boolean prettyPrint)
      Do the work of converting the Request object to a string, allowing for pretty-printing if desired.
      static Request load(java.io.File fileRequest)
      Read a file containing the JSON description of a XACML Request and parse it into a Request Object.
      static Request load(java.io.InputStream is)
      Read characters from the given InputStream and parse them into an XACML Request object.

      Parse and JSON string into a Request object.

      Convert the contents of a Content element from XML into XML Node

      Convert the Request into an JSON string with pretty-printing.

      • load

        public static Request load(java.io.File fileRequest)
                    throws JSONStructureException
        Read a file containing the JSON description of a XACML Request and parse it into a Request Object. This is only used for testing. In normal operation a Request arrives through the RESTful interface and is processed using load(String jsonString).
        Parameters:
        fileRequest -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        JSONStructureException

        public static void convert(Request request,

                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           JSONStructureException
        Convert the Request object into a string suitable for output. IMPORTANT: This method does NOT close the outputStream. It is the responsibility of the caller to (who opened the stream) to close it.
